text: Pou jwenn plis enfòmasyon klike sou lyen ki pi ba yo:

text: https://www.unicef.org/coronavirus/covid-19-parenting-tips

text: COVID19Parenting.com

text: https://www.acceleratehub.org/plh-research-outputs

text: https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019/advice-for-public/healthy-parenting

sourceText: Parenting tips from WHO
text: Konsèy ki soti nan WHO pou paran

sourceText: Parenting tips from UNICEF
text: Konsèy ki soti nan UNICEF pou paran

sourceText: In worldwide languages
text: Nan tout kalite lang yo pale nan mond lan

sourceText: evidence-base
text: baze sou bonjan prèv

sourceText: For more information click below links:
text: Pou jwenn plis enfòmasyon klike sou lyen ki pi ba yo:

sourceText: Listen to them, look at them. Give them your full attention. Have fun!
text: Tande yo, gade yo. Ba yo tout atansyon w. Byen pwofite!

sourceText: Read a book or look at pictures.
text: Li yon liv oswa gade foto yo.

sourceText: Make drawings with crayons or pencils.
text: Fè desen ak kreyon yo.

sourceText: Dance to music or sing songs!
text: Danse mizik oswa chante!

sourceText: Do a chore together –  make cleaning and cooking a game!
text: Fè yon travay ansanm – fè netwayay ak fè manje tounen jwèt!

sourceText: Help with school work.
text: Ede ak devwa lekòl.

sourceText: Ideas with your young child.
text: Ide sou sa w ka fè ak pitit ou ki jenn.

sourceText: Switch off the TV and phone. This is virus-free time.
text: Etenn televizyon an ak telefòn nan. Se yon moman ki pa gen okenn viris.

sourceText: Talk about something they like: sports, music, celebrities, friends.
text: Pale sou bagay yo renmen: spò, mizik, vedèt ak zanmi.

sourceText: Cook a favourite meal together.
text: Kwit yon manje nou renmen anpil ansanm.

sourceText: Exercise together to their favorite music.
text: Chante mizik prefere yo ansanm avèk yo.

sourceText: Ideas with your teenager.
text: Kèk bagay ou ka fè ak pitit ou ki adolesan.

sourceText: Copy their facial expression and sounds.
text: Imite yo nan jès yo fè ak fiji yo ak sa yap di.

sourceText: Sing songs, make music with pots and spoons.
text: Chante kèk chante, fè mizik ak veso ak kiyè.

sourceText: Stack cups or blocks.
text: Anpile gode oswa blòk yo.

sourceText: Tell a story, read a book, or share pictures.
text: Rakonte yon istwa, li yon liv oswa pataje photo yo.

sourceText: Ideas with your baby/toddler.
text: Ide sou sa w ka fè ak tibebe w.

sourceText: Choosing builds their self confidence.
text: Chwazi konstwi konfyans nan tet yo.

sourceText: If they want to do something that isn’t OK with physical distancing, then this is a chance to talk with them about this. (see next leaflet)
text: Si yo vle fè yon bagay ki pa posib pou w fè ak yon sèten distans fizik, lè sa a se yon posiblite pou w pale avèk yo sou sa (gade pwochen depliyan an)

sourceText: Ask your child what they would like to do.
text: Mande timoun ou yo kisa yo ta renmen fè.

sourceText: It can be for just 20 minutes, or longer – it’s up to us.
text: Se ka jis pou 20 minit, oswa plis – sa depann de nou.

sourceText: It can be at the same time each day so children or teenagers can look forward to it.
text: Sa kapab menm lè a chak jou pou timoun nan oswa adolesan an ka chofe pou sa a chak fwa.

sourceText: Set aside time to spend with each child.
text: Rezève tan pou w pase ak chak timoun.

sourceText: We can also see this as a chance to make better relationships with our children and teenagers.
text: Nou ka konsidere sa tou kòm yon posiblite pou gen pi bon relasyon ak timoun ou yo oswa pitit ou yo ki adolesan.

sourceText: One-on-One time is free and fun. It makes children feel loved and secure, and shows them that they are important.
text: Ti pale nou fè a de se yon moman ki lib e ki amizan. Sa fè timoun yo santi yo renmen l e li an sekirite, e sa fè yo santi yo enpòtan.

sourceText: Can’t go to work? Schools closed? Worried about money?
text: Ou pa ka al travay? Lekòl fèmen? Wap enkyete w parapò ak lajan?

sourceText: It is normal to feel stressed and overwhelmed.
text: Se nòmal ou santi w strese e w santi w about.

sourceText: One-on-One Time
text: Ti pale a de

sourceText: Covid-19 Parenting
text: Edikasyon timoun nan peryòd Covid-19

sourceText: Partners
text: Patnè yo

sourceText: Funders
text: Moun ki finanse yo

sourceText: Teens especially need to be able to communicate with their friends.
text: Adolesan yo sitou bezwen pou yo ka kominike ak zanmi yo.

sourceText: Help your teen connect through social media and other safe distancing ways.
text: Ede pitit ou ki adolesan konekte pa mwayen rezo sosyal oswa lòt mwayen ki san danje a distans.

sourceText: This is something you can do together, too!
text: Sa a se yon bagay nou ka fè ansanm tou!

sourceText: Use positive words when telling your child what to do; like “Please put your clothes away” (instead of “Don’t make a mess”).
text: itilize mo ki pozitif lè w ap di pitit ou sa pou l fè; tankou “Tanpri met rad ou yo nan plas yo” (olye “Poukisa la a tèt anba”).

sourceText: Say the behaviour you want to see.
text: Di fason w ta renmen wè yo konpòte yo.

sourceText: Help your teen stay connected.
text: Ede pitit ou ki adolesan rete konekte.

sourceText: Praise your child when they are behaving well.
text: Felisite pitit ou a lè l byen konpòte l.

sourceText: Keeping It Positive
text: Kenbe l pozitif

sourceText: Covid-19 Parenting
text: Edikasyon timoun nan peryòd Covid-19

sourceText: It‘s hard to feel positive when our kids or teenagers are driving us crazy. We often end up saying “Stop doing that!”
text: Sa difisil pou w rete pozitif lè timoun ou yo oswa adolesan yo soti pou yo fè w fou. Souvan, alafen ou di yo “Pa fè sa!”

sourceText: But children are much more likely to do what we ask if we give them positive instructions and lots of praise for what they do right.
text: Men timoun li pi fasil pou timoun yo fè sa nou mande yo si nou ba yo enstriksyon ki pozitif epi felisite yo souvan pou sa yo fè ki bon.

sourceText: Shouting at your child will just make you and them more stressed and angrier. Get your child’s attention by using their name. Speak in a calm voice.
text: Lè w rele sou yo sa fè ni ou ni yo vin pi an kòlè e pi strese. Chèche jwenn atansyon pitit ou lè rele yo nan non yo lè w ap pale ak yo. Pale ak yon ton vwa ki kalm.

sourceText: It’s all in the delivery.
text: Tout bagay la se fason w di sa wap di a.

sourceText: Try praising your child or teenager for something they have done well.
text: Eseye felisite timoun ou yo oswa pitit ou ki adolesan pou bon bagay yo fè.

sourceText: They may not show it, but you’ll see them doing that good thing again.
text: Yo ka pa montre sa, men ou pral wè yo k ap fè bon bagay sa a ankò.

sourceText: It will also reassure them that you notice and care.
text: Sa ap ba yo asirans ou wè sa yo fè epi w enterese nan sa yo fè.

sourceText: Can your child actually do what you are asking them?
text: Eske timoun ou yo ka vrèman fè sa w mande yo?

sourceText: It is very hard for a child to keep quiet inside for a whole day but maybe they can keep quiet for 15 minutes while you are on a call.
text: Li difisil anpil pou yon timoun rete an silans pandan tout yon jounen, men yo ka rete an silans pandan 15 minit pandan w nan yon apèl.

sourceText: Get real.
text: Se pou w reyalis.

sourceText: Parenting tips from WHO
text: Konsèy ki soti nan WHO pou paran

sourceText: Parenting tips from UNICEF
text: Konsèy ki soti nan UNICEF pou paran

sourceText: In worldwide languages
text: Nan tout kalite lang yo pale nan mond lan

sourceText: evidence-base
text: baze sou bonjan prèv

sourceText: For more information click below links:
text: Pou jwenn plis enfòmasyon klike sou lyen ki pi ba yo:

sourceText: Partners
text: Patnè yo

sourceText: Funders
text: Moun ki finanse yo

sourceText: Teach your child about keeping safe distances
text: Aprann pitit ou kijan pou l kenbe distans sekirite ak lòt moun

sourceText: Create a flexible but consistent daily routine.
text: Mete sou pye yon seri aktivite chak jou men se pou w dispoze epi adapte w tou pafwa.

sourceText: Make a schedule for you and your children that has time for structured activities as well as free time. This can help children feel more secure and better behaved.
text: Fè yon pwogram pou ou ak pitit ou ki byen òganize aktivite yo ak tan lib tou. Sa ka ede timoun yo santi yo pi an sekirite epi sa ka ede yo konpòte yo pi byen.

sourceText: Children or teenagers can help plan the routine for the day – like making a school timetable. Children will follow this better if they help to make it.
text: Timoun oswa adolesan yo ka ede planifye aktivite w fè chak jou yo – tankou yon pwogram sou fason y ap jere tan yo pou aktivite lekòl yo. Lap pi fasil pou yo suiv pwogram nan si yo te patisipe nan fè pwogram nan.

sourceText: Include exercise in each day - this helps with stress and kids with lots of energy at home.
text: Mete spò nan aktivite n ap fè chak jou - sa ka ede kont strès ak timoun ki gen anpil enèji lè yo ret lakay yo.

sourceText: You are a model for your child’s behavior.
text: Ou se yon egzanp pou sa ki gen rapò ak konpòtman pitit ou.

sourceText: If you practice keeping safe distances and hygiene yourself, and treat others with compassion, especially those who are sick or vulnerable – your children and teenagers will learn from you.
text: Si w respekte epi pratike distans sekirite epi w gen bon abitid ijyèn, epi w trete lòt moun ak konpasyon, sitou moun ki malad e ki pi frajil yo – timoun yo ak pitit ou ki adolesan ap imite w.

sourceText: At the end of each day, take a minute to think about the day. Tell your child about one positive or fun thing they did.
text: Nan fen chak jounen, pran yon ti tan pou w reflechi sou jounen an. Pale ak pitit ou sou yon bagay ki pozitif ak bagay ki gen plezi yo te fè.

sourceText: Praise yourself for what you did well today.
text: Felisite tèt ou pou bon bagay ou te fè jodi a.

sourceText: You are a star!
text: Ou se yon Jeni!

sourceText: If it is OK in your country, get children outside.
text: Si yo pèmèt sa nan peyi w, soti ak timoun yo.

sourceText: You can also write letters and draw pictures to share with people.
text: Ou ka fè lèt oswa desen pou w pataje ak lòt moun.

sourceText: Put them up outside your home for others to see!
text: Mete yo pa deyò kay ou pou lòt moun ka wè yo!

sourceText: You can reassure your child by talking about how you are keeping safe.
text: Sa ka soulaje pitit yo lè w di yo sa w fè pou pwoteje tèt ou.

sourceText: Listen to their suggestions and take them seriously.
text: Koute sijesyon yo epi pran yo oserye.

sourceText: Make handwashing and hygiene fun
text: Fè kesyon lave men ak ijyèn tounen yon bagay amizan

sourceText: Make a 20-second song for washing hands. Add actions!
text: Chante yon chante pandan 20 segond lè wap lave men w. Ajoute aksyon!

sourceText: Give children points and praise for regular handwashing.
text: Bay timoun yo pwen epi felisite yo paske yo lave men yo souvan.

sourceText: Make a game to see how few times we can touch our faces with a reward for the least number of touches (you can count for each other).
text: Fè yon jwèt pou w wè konbyen fwa nou ka touche figi nou epi nap rekonpanse moun ki touche figi l mwens fwa a (youn ka konte pou lòt).

sourceText: Structure Up
text: Òganize

sourceText: Covid-19 Parenting
text: Edikasyon timoun nan peryòd Covid-19

sourceText: COVID-19 has interrupted our daily work, home and school routines.
text: COVID-19 la te kanpe travay nou, aktivite nou fè lakay chak jou ak aktivite lekòl nou.

sourceText: This is hard for children, teenagers and for you. Making new routines can help.
text: Sa difisil anpil pou timoun yo, adolesan yo ak pou ou tou. Fè nouvo aktivite chak jou ka ede w.

sourceText: Parenting tips from WHO
text: Konsèy ki soti nan WHO pou paran

sourceText: Parenting tips from UNICEF
text: Konsèy ki soti nan UNICEF pou paran

sourceText: In worldwide languages
text: Nan tout kalite lang yo pale nan mond lan

sourceText: evidence-base
text: baze sou bonjan prèv

sourceText: For more information click below links:
text: Pou jwenn plis enfòmasyon klike sou lyen ki pi ba yo:

sourceText: Partners
text: Patnè yo

sourceText: Funders
text: Moun ki finanse yo

sourceText: Consequences help teach our children responsibility for what they do.
text: Konsekans yo ede w anseye pitit ou yo sans responsablite nan sa y ap fè.

sourceText: They also allow discipline that is controlled.
text: Yo pèmèt tou disiplin ki byen kontwole

sourceText: This is more effective than hitting or shouting.
text: Gen bagay ki pi efikas pase bat oswa rele sou timoun yo.

sourceText: Take a Pause.
text: Pran yon poz.

sourceText: Redirect.
text: Bay yon lòt oryantansyon.

sourceText: Give your child a choice to follow your instruction before giving them the consequence.
text: Bay pitit ou chwa pou l suiv entriksyon w ba li anvan w ba l pinisyon an.

sourceText: Try to stay calm when giving the consequence.
text: Eseye rete kalm lè w ap bay pinisyon.

sourceText: Make sure you can follow through with the consequence. For example, taking away a teenager’s phone for a week is hard to enforce. Taking it away for one hour is more realistic.
text: Asire w ou fè sa w di w ap fè a. Pa egzanp, sezi telefòn yon adolesan pandan yon semèn ka difisil anpil pou l respekte. Sezi telefòn nan pou inèdtan pi rezonab.

sourceText: Once the consequence is over, give your child a chance to do something good, and praise them for it.
text: Lè pinisyon an fini, bay pitit ou posiblite pou l fè yon bon bagay, epi felisite l pou sa.

sourceText: Keep using  Tips 1-3
text: Kontinye sèvi ak konsèy 1-3

sourceText: When Children Misbehave...
text: Lè timoun yo konpòte yo mal...

sourceText: Covid-19 Parenting
text: Edikasyon timoun nan peryòd Covid-19

sourceText: All children misbehave. It is normal when children are tired, hungry, afraid, or learning independence.
text: Tout timoun konn konpòte yo mal. Li nòmal pou sa rive lè timoun yo fatige, yo grangou, yo pè oswa y ap aprann vin gen yon sèten endepandans.

sourceText: And they can drive us crazy when stuck at home.
text: Yo ka soti pou fè nou fou lè yo rete bloke lakay.

sourceText: One-on-One time, praise for being good, and consistent routines will reduce difficult behaviour.
text: Ti pale a de, felisite yo lè yo aji byen, epi kontinye fè yon seri aktivite regilyèman ki ka redui pwoblèm nan konpòtman yo.

sourceText: Give your children and teens simple jobs with responsibilities. Just make sure it is something they are able to do. And praise them when they do it!
text: Ba timoun nan oswa adolesan an responsab yon seri travay ki senp. Jis asire w se yon bagay yo ka fè. E felisite yo lè yo fè l!

sourceText: Parenting tips from WHO
text: Konsèy ki soti nan WHO pou paran

sourceText: Parenting tips from UNICEF
text: Konsèy ki soti nan UNICEF pou paran

sourceText: In worldwide languages
text: Nan tout kalite lang yo pale nan mond lan

sourceText: evidence-base
text: baze sou bonjan prèv

sourceText: For more information click below links:
text: Pou jwenn plis enfòmasyon klike sou lyen ki pi ba yo:

sourceText: Use consequences.
text: Fason pou w sèvi ak pinisyon.

sourceText: Catch difficult behavior early and redirect your kids’ attention from a negative to a good behavior.
text: Trete konpòtman ki difisil yo bonè epi bay pitit ou atansyon ak yon lòt oryantasyon pou l soti nan yon move konpòtman pou l tounen bon konpòtman.

sourceText: Stop it before it starts!
text: Kanpe l anvan l kòmanse!

sourceText: When they start to get restless, you can distract with something interesting or fun: “Come, let’s play a game together.”
text: Lè l kòmanse bat kò l anpil, ou ka distrè l ak yon bagay ki enteresan oswa ki amizan: “Vini, ann jwe yon jwèt ansanm.”

sourceText: Feel like screaming?
text: Eske w santi w ta fè yon gwo rèl sou timoun nan?

sourceText: Give yourself a 10-second pause.
text: Pran yon poz 10 segond.

sourceText: Breathe in and out slowly five times.
text: Rale souf ou epi pouse l soti toudousman pandan 5 fwa.

sourceText: Then try to respond in a calmer way.
text: Eseye reponn yon fason ki kalm.

sourceText: Millions of parents say this helps - A LOT.
text: Plizyè milyon paran di sa ede - ANPIL.

sourceText: Partners
text: Patnè yo

sourceText: Funders
text: Moun ki finanse yo

sourceText: Millions of people have the same fears as us. Find someone who you can talk to about how you are feeling.
text: Menm sa k fè w pè a fè plizyè milyon moun pè tou. Chèche jwenn yon moun ou ka pale sou sa w santi.

sourceText: Listen to them. Avoid social media that makes you feel panicked.
text: Koute yo. Evite rezo sosyal ki ka fè w santi w panike.

sourceText: You are not alone.
text: Ou pa pou kò w.

sourceText: Take a break.
text: Pran yon poz.

sourceText: Listen to your kids.
text: Koute pitit ou yo.

sourceText: Take a Pause.
text: Pran yon poz.

sourceText: 1-minute relaxation activity that you can do whenever you are feeling stressed or worried.
text: Yon minit aktivite ki rilaks ou ka fè nenpòt lè w santi w estrese oswa w santi w enkyè.

sourceText: Step 1: Set up
text: Etap 1: Mete an plas

sourceText: •	Find a comfortable sitting position, your feet flat on the floor, your hands resting in your lap.
text: • Jwenn yon pozisyon pou w chita yon fason ki konfòtab, pye plat atè a, men w sou jenou w.

sourceText: • 	Close your eyes if you feel comfortable.
text: • Fèmen je si w santi w alèz konsa.

sourceText: Step 2: Think, feel, body
text: Etap 2: Panse, santiman, kò

sourceText: • 	Ask yourself, “What am I thinking now?”
text: • Mande tèt ou, “Sou kisa map panse kounye a?”

sourceText: • 	Notice your thoughts. Notice if they are negative or positive.
text: Analize refleksyon w yo. Disène si yo pozitif oswa negatif.

sourceText: • 	Notice how you feel emotionally. Notice if your feelings are happy or not.
text: • Disène kijan w santi w emosyonèlman. Disène si w kontan oswa si w pa kontan.

sourceText: • 	Notice how your body feels. Notice anything that hurts or is tense.
text: • Disène kijan kò santi l. Èske gen nenpòt bagay k ap fè w mal oswa ki rèd.

sourceText: Step 3: Focus on your breath
text: Etap 3: konsantre w sou respirasyon w

sourceText: • 	Listen to your breath as it goes in and out.
text: • Koute byen lè w ap rale souf ou antre ak pouse l soti.

sourceText: • 	You can put a hand on your stomach and feel it rise and fall with each breath.
text: • Ou ka mete yon men sou vant ou epi santi l k ap monte desann pou chak souf ou pran.

sourceText: • 	You may want to say to yourself “It’s okay.Whatever it is, I am okay.”
text: • Petèt ou ka di tèt ou “Tout bagay anfòm. Kèlkeswa jan sa ye, mwen anfòm.”

sourceText: • 	Then just listen to your breath for a while.
text: • Apre sa jis tande souf ou pou yon ti tan.

sourceText: Step 4: Coming back
text: Etap 4: Retounen

sourceText: • 	Notice how your whole body feels.
text: • Disène kijan tout kò w santi l.

sourceText: • 	Listen to the sounds in the room.
text: • Koute son ki nan chanm nan.

sourceText: Step 5: Reflecting
text: Etap 5: Refleksyon

sourceText: • 	Think “do I feel different at all?”.
text: • Panse “eske m santi m diferan?”.

sourceText: • 	When you are ready, open your eyes.
text: • Lè w santi w pare, ouvè je w.

sourceText: Be open and listen to your children. Your children will look to you for support and reassurance.
text: Se pou w abòdab epi koute pitit ou. Pitit ou ap vin kote w pou yo jwenn èd ak rekonfò.

sourceText: Listen to your children when they share how they are feeling.
text: Koute pitit ou lè yap di w kijan yo santi yo.

sourceText: Accept how they feel and give them  comfort.
text: Aksepte fason yo santi yo epi ba yo rekonfò.

sourceText: Taking a Pause can also be helpful when you find your child is irritating you or has done something wrong. It gives you a chance to be calmer.
text: Pran yon poz kapab ede w tou lè w twouve pitit ou kontrarye w, oswa li fè yon bagay mal. Sa ba w posiblite pou w vin pi kalm.

sourceText: Even a few deep breaths or connecting with the feeling of the floor beneath can make a difference.
text: Kèk respirasyon byen fon pandan yon ti tan oswa konekte w ak atè kote pye w ye a ka fè yon gwo diferans.

sourceText: You can also Take a Pause with your children!
text: Ou ka pran yon poz ak timoun ou yo tou!

sourceText: Keep Calm and Manage Stress
text: Rete kalm epi jere estrès ou

sourceText: Covid-19 Parenting
text: Edikasyon timoun nan peryòd Covid-19

sourceText: This is a stressful time. Take care of yourself, so you can support your children.
text: Sa se yon moman ki bay anpil estrès. Pran swen tèt ou pou w ka ede pitit ou.

sourceText: Parenting tips from WHO
text: Konsèy ki soti nan WHO pou paran

sourceText: Parenting tips from UNICEF
text: Konsèy ki soti nan UNICEF pou paran

sourceText: In worldwide languages
text: Nan tout kalite lang yo pale nan mond lan

sourceText: evidence-base
text: baze sou bonjan prèv

sourceText: For more information click below links:
text: Pou jwenn plis enfòmasyon klike sou lyen ki pi ba yo:

sourceText: We all need a break sometimes. When your children are asleep, do something fun or relaxing for yourself.
text: W ap bezwen yon ti poz pafwa. Lè timoun ou yo ap dòmi fè yon bagay ki amizan epi ki rilaks pou tèt pa ou.

sourceText: Make a list of healthy activities that YOU like to do. You deserve it!
text: Fè yon lis aktivite ki bon pou kò w ak lespri w OU RENMEN fè. Ou merite sa!

sourceText: Partners
text: Patnè yo

sourceText: Funders
text: Moun ki finanse yo

sourceText: It is fine to say “We don’t know, but we are working on it; or we don’t know, ‘but we think’.”
text: Sa bon pou w di “Nou pa konnen, men nap travay sou sa; oswa nou pa konnen, ‘men nou panse’.”

sourceText: Use this as an opportunity to learn something new with your child!
text: Sèvi ak posiblite sa pou w aprann yon nouvo bagay ak pitit ou!

sourceText: Allow your child to talk freely. Ask them open questions and find out how much they already know.
text: Pèmèt pitit ou pale san l pa pè di sa l panse. Poze yo kesyon ouvè epi chache konnen ki kantite bagay yo konnen deja.

sourceText: Always answer their questions truthfully. Think about how old your child is and how much they can understand.
text: Toujou di yo laverite lè w ap reponn kesyon yo. Reflechi sou ki laj pitit ou ak ki kantite bagay yo ka konprann.

sourceText: Be open and listen.
text: Se pou w abòdab epi se pou w koute.

sourceText: Be honest.
text: Se pou w onèt

sourceText: Be supportive.
text: Se pou w ede yo.

sourceText: It is OK not to know the answers.
text: Se pa yon mal ditou si w pa konn repons kesyon yo.

sourceText: There are a lot of stories going around
text: Gen yon pakèt istwa kap sikile

sourceText: Some may not be true. Use trustworthy sites:https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019/advice-for-publicandhttps://www.unicef.org/coronavirus/covid-19from WHO and UNICEF.
text: Gen kèk ki ka pa vre. Sèvi ak sit moun fè konfyans:https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019/advice-for-publicandhttps://www.unicef.org/coronavirus/covid-19se sit WHO ak UNICEF.

sourceText: Check to see if your child is okay. Remind them that you care and that they can talk to you anytime. Then do something fun together!
text: Verifye si pitit ou anfòm. Fè yo sonje ou gen sousi pou yo epi yo ka pale avè w nenpòt ki lè. Apre sa fè yon bagay ki gen plezi ansanm!

sourceText: End on a good note.
text: Fini ak yon pawòl pozitif.

sourceText: Talking about COVID-19
text: Pale konsènan COVID-19

sourceText: Covid-19 Parenting
text: Edikasyon timoun nan peryòd Covid-19

sourceText: Be willing to talk. They will already have heard something. Silence and secrets do not protect our children.
text: Se pou w dispoze pou w pale. Y ap deja tande yon bagay sou sa. Rete san w pa di anyen oswa kenbe enfòmasyon yo sekrè pap pwoteje pitit nou yo.

sourceText: Honesty and openness do. Think about how much they will understand.
text: Se pou w onèt epi klè. Reflechi sou ki kantite y ap konprann.

sourceText: You know them best.
text: Ou pi byen konnen yo.

sourceText: Your child may be scared or confused.
text: Pitit ou a ka pè oswa li ka nan konfizyon.

sourceText: Give them space to share how they are feeling and let them know you are there for them.
text: Ba yo espas pou yo pataje avè w jan yo santi yo epi fè yo konnen ou la pou yo.

sourceText: Parenting tips from WHO
text: Konsèy ki soti nan WHO pou paran

sourceText: Parenting tips from UNICEF
text: Konsèy ki soti nan UNICEF pou paran

sourceText: In worldwide languages
text: Nan tout kalite lang yo pale nan mond lan

sourceText: evidence-base
text: baze sou bonjan prèv

sourceText: For more information click below links:
text: Pou jwenn plis enfòmasyon klike sou lyen ki pi ba yo:

sourceText: Heroes not bullies.
text: Se pou w yon ewo, men pa yon moun k ap domine.

sourceText: Explain that COVID-19 has nothing to do with the way someone looks, where they are from, or what language they speak.
text: Esplike yo COVID-19 pa gen anyen pou l wè ak aparans yon moun, kote yo soti, oswa lang yo pale.

sourceText: Tell your child that we can be compassionate to people who are sick and those who are caring for them.
text: Di pitit ou yo ka montre yo gen kè sansib pou moun ki malad ak moun kap pran swen moun sa yo.

sourceText: Look for stories of people who are working to stop the outbreak and are caring for sick people.
text: Chèche istwa moun k ap travay pou mete fen nan epidemi an ak moun k ap pran swen moun ki malad.

sourceText: Partners
text: Patnè yo

sourceText: Funders
text: Moun ki finanse yo
